com.beaglebuddy.id3.v24.frame_body

Class ID3v24FrameBodyUserDefinedURLLink

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.beaglebuddy.util.Utility
      • com.beaglebuddy.id3.v24.frame_body.ID3v24FrameBodyUtility
        • com.beaglebuddy.id3.v24.frame_body.ID3v24FrameBody
          • com.beaglebuddy.id3.v24.frame_body.ID3v24FrameBodyUserDefinedURLLink

  • public class ID3v24FrameBodyUserDefinedURLLink
extends ID3v24FrameBody

    A user defined url link frame body is associated with an ID3v2.4 WXXX frame which is used to include URL links concerning the audio file in a similar way to the other url link frames. The user defined url link frame body contains the following fields:

    User Defined URL Link Frame Body Fields
     FieldDescription
    1. encodingcharacter set used to encode the description field.
    2. description description of the url.
    3. url URL of a website.

    There may be more than one user defined url link frame in an ID3v2.4 tag, but only one with the same description field.

    See Also:
    ID3v24Frame, ID3 tag version 2.4.0 standard, wikipedia history of ID3 tags

    • Constructor Detail

      • ID3v24FrameBodyUserDefinedURLLink

        public ID3v24FrameBodyUserDefinedURLLink()
        The default constructor is called when creating a new frame. The default values used are:
        • ISO-8859-1 encoding
        • empty description
        • empty URL

        • ID3v24FrameBodyUserDefinedURLLink

          public ID3v24FrameBodyUserDefinedURLLink(Encoding encoding,
                                         java.lang.String description,
                                         java.lang.String url)
          This constructor is called when creating a new frame.

          Parameters:
          encoding - character set used to encode the description.
          description - description of the url.
          url - url.

        • ID3v24FrameBodyUserDefinedURLLink

          public ID3v24FrameBodyUserDefinedURLLink(java.io.InputStream inputStream,
                                         int frameBodySize)
                                  throws java.io.IOException
          This constructor is called when reading in an existing frame from an .mp3 file. This is then followed by a call to the parse() method.
          Parameters:
          inputStream - input stream pointing to a user defined url link frame body in the .mp3 file.
          frameBodySize - size (in bytes) of the frame's body.
          Throws:
          java.io.IOException - if there is an error while reading the frame body.

        • setBuffer

          public void setBuffer()
          If the frame body's values have been modified, then resize the raw binary buffer and store the new values there. When finished, the dirty flag is reset to indicate that the buffer is up to date, and the frame is now ready to be saved to the .mp3 file.
          Overrides:
          setBuffer in class ID3v24FrameBody

        • toString

          public java.lang.String toString()
          gets a string representation of the user defined url link frame body showing all of the frame's fields and their values.
          Overrides:
          toString in class java.lang.Object
          Returns:
          a string representation of the frame body.
